title: How to make friends with happy people - Quora

response.answer_text: No one is happy all the time. That said, most people are not dealing with serious depression or anxiety. If the definition of happy people is people who feel happy often, and are not loaded down with depression or extreme anxiety (everyone has some anxiety sometimes), then the good news is there are happy people pretty much anywhere you might go. School, work, service clubs, your neighborhood, library, grocery store, etc. The bad news is, if you haven’t noticed how many happy people are around you, then you might have trouble making friends with happy people, because you tend to find them boring, or at least uninteresting. Happy people like to get things done. Try joining a club or two at school, especially service clubs (eg. where people join them to accomplish things like fixing up the gardens, visiting lonely old people, working at a soup kitchen). Watch the people around you, and try to especially pay attention to people who have the combination of not seeming very interesting, but also tend to smile at others. Happy people are not boring, but if you are used to people who exude drama or comedy, you might not notice those who don’t. Happy people can be happy without showing off, without complaining, without making people laugh. There are happy people who do those things, of course, but often, the happiest people are too busy accomplishing something to bother with self-aggrandizement, complaints, or clowning around. You want to be friends with happy people? Look for the people who are busy and smiling, and then smile at them, and get to work next to them. You make friends with happy people by noticing them, and then doing stuff with them that they do. Of course, happy people hang out with friends, and just talk and eat. But to become their friend, if you haven’t managed to become friends with a happy person before, means you have to do something other than what you have always done before. Activities are the easiest way to make new friends. Volunteer. Join a club. Do something active, with a purpose. The other people out there doing those things are where you find happy people to be friends with. Not that everyone who joins a club or volunteers is happy, but these activities make it easier to find and make friends with happy people.
